    • Method Detail

      • buildUpon

        public RunPolicy.Builder buildUpon()
        Returns:
        A RunPolicy Builder based on this RunPolicy. Note the Builder does not modify existing RunPolicies, it builds new ones.

      • getJobId

        public Job.JobId getJobId()
        Returns:
        The ID of the associated job

      • getConcurrencyPolicy

        public AbstractConcurrencyPolicy getConcurrencyPolicy()
        Returns:
        The RunPolicy's ConcurrencyPolicy, or null

      • getTimeJobStarted

        public long getTimeJobStarted()
        Returns:
        Get the timestamp the job was started.

      • getTimeOfNextAttempt

        public long getTimeOfNextAttempt()
        Returns:
        Get the timestamp of the next attempt, if applicable. The attempt may have already started.

      • getTimeAttemptStarted

        public long getTimeAttemptStarted()
        Returns:
        Get the time the most recent attempt started, if applicable.

      • onAttemptStarted

        public void onAttemptStarted()
        Notify the RunPolicy that a new attempt has started

      • shouldFailJob

        public boolean shouldFailJob()
        Returns:
        True if the Job should fail due to excessive attempts or timeout.

      • shouldFailAttempt

        public boolean shouldFailAttempt()
        Returns:
        True if the attempt should fail due to timeout

      • validateRequestedState

        public State validateRequestedState(State state)
        Validate a requested state against a run policy.
        Parameters:
        state - The desired state to transition to
        Returns:
        Returns the desired state if legal, or a different one if not.

      • onAttemptFailed

        public State onAttemptFailed()
        Notify the RunPolicy of a failed attempt.
        Returns:
        FAULTED if the RunPolicy is out of attempts, else WAIT

      • shouldStart

        public boolean shouldStart()
        Check the RunPolicy to see if it's time to start an attempt
        Returns:
        True if an attempt should start.

      • reset

        public RunPolicy reset()
        Reset all attempt counts to zero and the start time to now.
        Returns:
        the reset RunPolicy

      • scheduleNow

        public void scheduleNow()
        Schedule an attempt to run as soon as possible, if any attempts remain.

      • getJobTimeout

        public long getJobTimeout()
        Returns:
        The job timeout value as a duration in ms

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • getMessage

        public java.lang.String getMessage()
        Returns:
        A message for logging, one of "No more retries", "Job timed out", or null

      • getInitialDelay

        public long getInitialDelay()
        Returns:
        The RunPolicy's initial delay in ms

      • newLimitAttemptsPolicy

        public static RunPolicy.Builder newLimitAttemptsPolicy(int numAttempts)
        Convenience function to generate a RunPolicy Builder for a specified number of attempts and sane defaults for retry delay, attempt timeout, and job timeout.
        Parameters:
        numAttempts - The max number of attempts
        Returns:
        a RunPolicy Builder

      • newLimitAttemptsPolicy

        public static RunPolicy.Builder newLimitAttemptsPolicy()
        Convenience function to generate a RunPolicy Builder for max 5 attempts and sane defaults for retry delay, attempt timeout, and job timeout.
        Returns:
        a RunPolicy builder

      • newJobTimeoutPolicy

        public static RunPolicy.Builder newJobTimeoutPolicy(long timeout,
                                                    java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Convenience function to generate a RunPolicy Builder with a specified job timeout and sane defaults for retry delay, attempt timeout, and job timeout.
        Returns:
        a RunPolicy builder

      • getMaxJobAttempts

        public int getMaxJobAttempts()
        Returns:
        The max number of job attempts as configured

      • getAttemptsRemaining

        public int getAttemptsRemaining()
        Returns:
        The remaining number of attempts

      • getDelayOnFailedAttempt

        public long getDelayOnFailedAttempt()
        Returns:
        The configured delay before attempting a retry. This value can be dynamic if exponential backoff is used.

      • getDelayOnFailedAttemptMax

        public long getDelayOnFailedAttemptMax()
        Returns:
        The configured maximum delay before attempting a retry. Used in conjunction with exponential backoff.

      • getAttemptTimeout

        public long getAttemptTimeout()
        Returns:
        The maximum age for an attempt in ms
